newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK's new airport on schedule, within budget.
newsitem.headline: HK's new airport on schedule, within budget.

text.p: Hong Kong's new Chek Lap Kok airport and its extensive connecting railway project are set to be unveiled on schedule, without overstepping their budget, a senior British official said on Thursday.

"We...are confident that the airport and airport railway will be completed within budget by, respectively, April and June 1998," said Hugh Davies, head of the British team in the Sino-British Joint Liaison Group (JLG).
Davies was speaking to reporters after a meeting of the JLG, the diplomatic body handling Hong Kong's transition to Chinese sovereignty, to discuss the progress of the airport project.
The JLG agreed in 1994 that the two projects would be financed with HK$60.3 billion of Hong Kong government equity and HK$23 billion of private sector debt.

Chek Lap Kok airport is being built on an island off the coast of Hong Kong, and had originally been meant to be ready by the mid-1997 return of the British colony to China, but had been delayed by Sino-British disputes over its financing.
Hong Kong's existing Kai Tak aiport, on a narrow strip of land jutting out of the Kowloon peninsula, is already considered to have reached capacity.
